description.text: The image is a collage of eight images of Lord Ganesha depicted in various backgrounds, with various animals. [clockwise, starting with the top left image] 1. Ganesha stands with a cow behind him. He has a halo around his head and carries an axe, a lotus flower and a modak (sweet). 2. Ganesha is sitting on a peacock with his two consorts, Buddhi (wisdom) and Siddhi (success) sitting on his lap. He carries the ankusa (axe with a hook), a lasso and a modak (sweet). 3. Ganesha riding a horse and carrying the ankusa (axe with a hook), and a lotus flower. 4. Ganesha riding atop a flying swan. He carries a lotus flower, a conch, a lotus flower and an ankusa (axe with a hook) 5. Ganesha sitting on a hooded snake and leaning against a bolster. He holds a lasso, a trident and the ankusa (axe with a hook) in his hands. 6. The central image has Ganesha sitting on a golden throne- with a conch, lotus flower, modak (sweet) and the broken end of his tusk in his hands. He carries a small pot curled in his trunk and wears a crown, garland and cape. Various offerings are placed in containers in front of him. 7. Ganesha depicted with six hands sitting on his mount, a mouse. He carries a sword, trident, lotus flower, a snake and an axe. 8. Ganesha depicted with eight hands and four hands, sitting on a lion. Each of the depictions of Ganesha is set within a gold, carved frame and set against a blue background. The spaces between the frames on top have the religious symbol, om on a design and two pots with a coconut in them. The artist's name is P. K. M. [Senung?].

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

ext:item.ext:value: description-en: The image is a collage of eight images of Lord Ganesha depicted in various backgrounds, with various animals. [clockwise, starting with the top left image] 1. Ganesha stands with a cow behind him. He has a halo around his head and carries an axe, a lotus flower and a modak (sweet). 2. Ganesha riding a horse and carrying the ankusa (axe with a hook), and a lotus flower. 4. Ganesha riding atop a flying swan. He carries a lotus flower, a conch, a lotus flower and an ankusa (axe with a hook) 5. Ganesha sitting on a hooded snake and leaning against a bolster. He holds a lasso, a trident and the ankusa (axe with a hook) in his hands. 6. The central image has Ganesha sitting on a golden throne- with a conch, lotus flower, modak (sweet) and the broken end of his tusk in his hands. He carries a small pot curled in his trunk and wears a crown, garland and cape. Various offerings are placed in containers in front of him. 7. Each of the depictions of Ganesha is set within a gold, carved frame and set against a blue background. The spaces between the frames on top have the religious symbol, om on a design and two pots with a coconut in them. The artist's name is P. K. M. [Senung?]. (sp)
explanatory comments/crosstagging: Advertisement in "Indian Express" celebrating the amazing success of Manoj Kumar's film "Roti, Kapda Aur Makan". (ja)
Advertisement in "Indian Express" celebrating the amazing success of Manoj Kumar's film "Roti, Kapda Aur Makan".
